intro: Aciphylla cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilaginous aciphylla, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming structure with dense, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Aciphylla cartilaginea is adapted to grow in harsh, alpine environments, showcasing resilience to cold and strong winds. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
